Context: The text provides information about Eduroam, which is the Wi-Fi network for George Brown College employees, faculty, and students. It offers fast, reliable, and secure connectivity to college resources such as shared drives, intranet portals, and more. Students and employees can also connect using the eduroam app or get help from the IT Help Desk at 415-5000 ext. 4357 (HELP) or via email at helpdesk@georgebrown.ca. Eduroam is designed to be user-friendly and allows users to connect to participating institutions' Wi-Fi networks using their credentials. The authentication process is secure and fast, thanks to a network of servers run by participating institutions and National Research and Education Networks (NRENs). Each institution offering eduroam can apply its own filtering policies. Access varies based on user profiles, and generally, employees and students can connect to shared drives, intranet portals, printers, and more. Eduroam is a global Wi-Fi service specifically developed for the international research and education community and offers secure encryption and authentication standards that exceed typical commercial hotspots. To learn more about George Brown College or sign up for updates, students can visit the website or contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The contact numbers provided are 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559. George Brown College's social media hub can also be visited for more information. The text includes the emails helpdesk@georgebrown.ca and ask.george@georgebrown.ca, the phone number 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and the website link for sign-ups and more information. The text also mentions Toronto Metropolitan University as a participating Canadian institution.
